page.title: 15Wendover Garden Centre
page.content: World's End Garden Centre is a rapidly expanding family business. The Bone Brothers, former market stall holders became owners in 1970. Trade expanded and now sixteen building have been erected on the 7 acre site. The family employs a full-time staff of 30 and 15 part-time helpers, making the centre the largest employer in Wendover. Most produce comes from Nine Elms but bulbs and flowers are often obtained from other countries. The popularity of the centre is evident from the consistently busy car park, currently being extended and the queues of customers. The owners recognise the need to provide family appeal and the site includes a pet shop, a coffee shop, garden furniture and barbeque department, general garden & home requirements.
